title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 59.5 - In-line skates
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 59.5 - In-line skates

State Regulations
(a) In-line skate shall be defined as set forth in section
140-a
of the Vehicle and Traffic Law. (b) Reflective material required. Every in-line skate, except those made for
special use by highly skilled or expert skaters or for sale or distribution
through custom orders (such as in-line hockey skates and in-line speed skates)
shall be equipped with a reflective device or material meeting the following
standards: (1)
surface area. The total
surface area of the reflective device or material shall be at least one square
inch; and
(2)
location. At least 25
percent of the surface area of the reflective device or material shall be
located on the back of each skate. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
59.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
